error.signature: An error occurred (AccessDenied) when calling the AssumeRole operation

verdict.summary: IAM identity cannot assume the target role — trust policy or permissions boundary issue.

dead_ends.action: Attaching AdministratorAccess to the calling identity
Modifying the role trust policy to allow all principals
dead_ends.why_fails: Any AWS account could assume the role

workarounds.action: Check the role's trust policy: ensure the calling principal is listed in the trust relationship
workarounds.how: aws iam get-role --role-name <role> shows the trust policy

workarounds.action: Verify the caller has sts:AssumeRole permission in their IAM policy
workarounds.how: The caller needs permission to assume AND the role must trust the caller

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'An error occurred (AccessDenied) when calling the AssumeRole operation' indicates an IAM permission denial, while 'service unable to place tasks' indicates ECS unable to place tasks on instances.
